thread.title: Ras Al Khaimah charity contributes Dh122k for orphans
thread.title_full: Ras Al Khaimah charity contributes Dh122k for orphans

title: Ras Al Khaimah charity contributes Dh122k for orphans
text: (Supplied photo) Each and every orphan will get Dh1,800 a year for four years. The Ras Al Khaimah Charity Foundation has contributed Dh122,400 to the Human Appeal International for supporting 17 orphans in Arab and Islamic countries. Mohammed Jakkah Al Mansouri, Secretary General of the Ras Al Khaimah Charity Foundation, told Khaleej Times that each and every orphan will get Dh1,800 a year for four years. A cheque of the contribution has been given to Rashid Obaid Al Shehi, the executive in charge of aids and social services with the Human Appeal International. "The move, in collaboration with charity entities, is meant to support the poor and low-income people and help them live a sound life, as per the directives of UAE prudent leadership." Hailing the move, Al Shehi said the kind gesture will give a boost to indigent people locally and across the globe. "The Human Appeal International is sponsoring over 70,000 orphans all over the world." Ras Al Khaimah Charity Foundation contributed a cheque of Dh280,000 to the Al Rahmah for charity in Ras Al Khaimah last year, Al Mansouri said. "The amount was aimed to support 39 orphans in some poor countries for four years." - ahmedshaaban@khaleejtimes.com Ahmed Shaaban Originally from Egypt, I have been in Dubai since December 2005. Before coming here, I worked as an English language instructor, chief En/Ar translator, proofreader, reporter in Egypt and Qatar. I have also worked as a reporter, correspondent and simultaneous translator with two satellite channels in Dubai. I have a masters degree in media, Cairo University, 2014, a bachelor degree in English language and translation, Ain Shams University, Cairo, 1996, and three post-graduate diplomas in English language and Instruction. With over 19 years of experience in translation, interpretation, EFL instruction, and reporting. I am interested in technology, aviation, politics, as well as community, parliament and defence issues. I enjoy reading, writing, exercising, and surfing the web. Share
